actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on February 28, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Kiley moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 164 — "Electing Members to certain standing committees of the House of Representatives."
The House received a communication from the Honorable Jason Crow. Mr. Crow submitted his resignation from the Committee on Armed Services. The resignation was accepted without objection.

The House received a communication from the Honorable Ami Bera. Mr. Bera submitted his resignation from the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology. The resignation was accepted without objection.
The House received a communication from the Honorable Stacey E. Plaskett. Ms. Plaskett submitted her resignation from the Committee on Agriculture. The resignation was accepted without objection.
The House received a communication from the Honorable Jim Costa. Mr. Costa submitted his resignation from the Committee on Natural Resources. The resignation was accepted without objection.

The House received a communication from the Honorable Mikie Sherrill. Ms. Sherrill submitted her resignation from the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology. The resignation was accepted without objection.
The House observed a moment of silence in rememberance of the victims of the recent shooting at Michigan State University.
On approving the Journal Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 406
actions-list.actionItem: 12 (Roll no. 121).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 538 — "To require the disclosure of a camera or recording capability in certain internet-connected devices."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 414
actions-list.actionItem: 2 (Roll no. 120).

The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on the motion to suspend the rules and agree to H. Res. 132, pass H.R. 538, and agree to the Speaker's Approval of the Journal, if ordered, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 27.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for approximately 6:30 p.m. today.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1059.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bilirakis moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1059 — "To authorize notaries public to perform, and to establish minimum standards for, electronic notarizations and remote notarizations that occur in or affect interstate commerce, to require any Federal court to recognize notarizations performed by a notarial officer of any State, to require any State to recognize notarizations performed by a notarial officer of any other State when the notarization was performed under or relates to a public Act, record, or judicial proceeding of the notarial officer's State or when the notarization occurs in or affects interstate commerce, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 538.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Bilirakis moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 538 — "To require the disclosure of a camera or recording capability in certain internet-connected devices."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1108.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Latta moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1108 — "To amend the Communications Act of 1934 to extend the authority of the Federal Communications Commission to grant a license or construction permit through a system of competitive bidding."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 132.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Wilson (SC) moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution. H. Res. 132 — "Responding to the earthquakes in Türkiye and Syria on February 6, 2023."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 27.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. McGovern to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.

The Chair announced that he had examined the Journal of the last day's proceedings and had approved it. Mr. Wiliams(TX) demanded that the question be put on agreeing to the Speaker's approval of the Journal and by voice vote, the Chair announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Williams(TX) objected to the voice vote based upon the absence of a quorum and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of agreeing to the Speaker's approval of the Journal until a time to be announced.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 27.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for  2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Nick LaLota to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
